10711.Description: Use 4 small prisms to restore 30%-60% of a level 0-30 item's transmutation durability. After using this recipe on an item, you must wait 4 days before the item can be further repaired.
10711.Name: Repair Transmutation Damage 1

10712.Description: Use 6 small prisms to restore 60%-100% of a level 0-30 item's transmutation durability. After using this recipe on an item, you must wait 6 days before the item can be further repaired.
10712.Name: Repair Transmutation Damage 2

10713.Description: Use 8 small prisms to restore 100% of a level 0-30 item's transmutation durability. After using this recipe on an item, you must wait 7 days before the item can be further repaired.
10713.Name: Repair Transmutation Damage 3

10714.Description: Use 8 medium prisms to restore 100% of a level 31-60 item's transmutation durability. After using this recipe on an item, you must wait 7 days before the item can be further repaired.
10714.Name: Repair Transmutation Damage 4

10715.Description: Use 8 large prisms to restore 100% of a level 61-90 item's transmutation durability. After using this recipe on an item, you must wait 7 days before the item can be further repaired.
10715.Name: Repair Transmutation Damage 5

10716.Description: Use 15 large prisms to restore 100% of a Mastercrafted item's transmutation durability. Unlike other transmutation-repair recipes, this technique can be used as often as desired.
10716.Name: Repair Transmutation Damage: Mastercrafted

22501.Description: An elaborate contraption that can dispense free items. This model can dispense up to 10 of a single kind of item.
22501.Name: Simple Item Dispenser

22502.Description: An elaborate contraption that can dispense free items. This model can dispense up to 1000 of a single kind of item.
22502.Name: Large-Capacity Item Dispenser

22503.Description: An elaborate contraption that can dispense free items. This model can dispense up to 1000 of a single kind of item and has a place for a custom message that all visitors will see.
22503.Name: Fancy Item Dispenser

22504.Description: An elaborate contraption that can dispense items and collect currency. This model can sell up to 10 of a single kind of item.
22504.Name: Simple Item Vendor

22505.Description: An elaborate contraption that can dispense items and collect currency. This model can sell up to 1000 of a single kind of item.
22505.Name: Large-Capacity Item Vendor

22506.Description: An elaborate contraption that can dispense items and collect currency. This model can sell up to 1000 of a single kind of item and has a place for a custom message that all users will see.
22506.Name: Fancy Item Vendor

22521.Description:
An elaborate contraption that can dispense free raffle tickets and then deliver a reward to the raffle winner.

This model can dispense up to 10 free raffle tickets for a single item (or item stack).
22521.Name: Simple Free Item Raffler

22522.Description:
An elaborate contraption that can dispense free raffle tickets and then deliver a reward to the raffle winner.

This model can dispense up to 20 free raffle tickets for 1 or 2 items (or item stacks) and/or a small cash prize.
22522.Name: Modest Free Item Raffler

22523.Description:
An elaborate contraption that can dispense raffle tickets and then deliver a reward to the raffle winner.

This model can dispense up to 30 raffle tickets for up to 3 items (or item stacks) and/or a cash prize. The raffle tickets can be free or can cost Councils.
22523.Name: Standard Item Raffler

22524.Description:
An elaborate contraption that can dispense raffle tickets and then deliver a reward to the raffle winner.

This model can dispense up to 50 raffle tickets for up to 6 items (or item stacks) and/or a cash prize. The raffle tickets can be free or can cost Councils. This model has a place for an inscription that is displayed to each user.
22524.Name: Fancy Item Raffler

22525.Description:
An elaborate contraption that can dispense raffle tickets and then deliver a reward to the raffle winner.

This model can dispense up to 100 raffle tickets for up to 8 items (or item stacks) and/or a cash prize. The raffle tickets can be free or can cost Councils. This model has a place for an inscription that is displayed to each user, and a message that is shown only to the winner. This model can also be configured to have a time limit of 1-60 minutes.
22525.Name: Advanced Item Raffler

22526.Description:
An elaborate contraption that can dispense raffle tickets and then deliver a reward to the raffle winner.

This model can dispense up to 1000 raffle tickets for up to 10 items (or item stacks) and/or a cash prize. The raffle tickets can be free or can cost Councils. This model has a place for an inscription that is displayed to each user, and a message that is shown only to the winner. This model can also be configured to have a time limit of 1-90 minutes.
22526.Name: Ultra Item Raffler

22541.Description: Creates some single-use traps that will stun an enemy that wanders over it. Works on pretty much anything, not just rats. (Except for Elites.)
22541.Name: Paralyzing Rat Trap

22561.Description: A very basic animal cage designed for transfering pets. Suitable only for extremely short-term use! Pets kept in this cage for more than 48 hours will escape and be lost. One use only.
22561.Name: Simple Travel Cage

22562.Description: Designed for longer transit periods, this travel cage provides basic sustenance and comfort for a short time. Pets kept in this cage for more than 7 days (or more specifically, 168 hours) will escape and be lost. One use only.
22562.Name: Robust Travel Cage

22571.Description: A longer-term storage solution for pets. The built-in entertainment options raise the contained pet's Happiness by 10. Pets kept in this cage for more than 14 days will escape and be lost. One use only.
22571.Name: Simple Kennel

22572.Description: A long-term storage solution for pets. The built-in entertainment options raise the contained pets' Happiness by 20. Pets kept in this cage for more than 28 days will escape and be lost. One use only.
22572.Name: Robust Kennel

22573.Description: A magical freezing system for long-term pet storage. The pet is placed into suspended animation, unable to move, but still able to dream -- and to have nightmares, which cause the pet to lose all of its Happiness. Pets kept in this container for more than 90 days escape and are lost. One use only.
22573.Name: Cryogenic Pet Crate

22591.Description: Creates special cushions of warmth that help incubate baby bees and wasps in the egg. Each can be used only once.
22591.Name: Miniature Egg Incubator

22592.Description: Creates special cushions of warmth that help incubate baby bees and wasps in the egg. This version also includes pheromones that relax the creature and help it grow more quickly. Each incubator be used only once.
22592.Name: Super Egg Incubator

22601.Description: Creates a music box that sounds like a lute for beast forms to use for gardening or dancing.
22601.Name: Shoddy Music Box

23001.Description: Analyze and decompose a Human Skull to get hands-on Phrenology experience for that race. There is a 1% chance your research apparatus will break.
23001.Name: Human Phrenology Research

23002.Description: Analyze and decompose an Impressive Human Skull to get hands-on Phrenology experience for that race. There is a 1% chance your research apparatus will break.
23002.Name: Human Phrenology Research 2

23003.Description: Analyze and decompose an Astonishing Human Skull to get hands-on Phrenology experience for that race. There is a 1% chance your research apparatus will break.

23101.Name: Weather Witching Research Level 1

23151.Description: Increase your Maximum Tempest Energy through a simple ceremony. It must be performed at noon [game time] on a perfectly clear day. It can be performed repeatedly on different days. Each performance permanently increases your Maximum Tempest Energy +1.
23151.Name: Song of the Sun

23152.Description: Increase your Maximum Tempest Energy +5 through a mysterious ceremony. It must be performed at midnight [game time] on a new moon [real world]. It need only be performed once; the effects are permanent.
23152.Name: Litany of Stillness

23153.Description: Increase your Maximum Tempest Energy +5 through a simple ritual. The ritual need only be performed once; the effects are permanent. It must be performed at precisely 4AM [game time] while in a sandstorm.
23153.Name: Trial of Lannasea

23154.Description: Increase your Maximum Tempest Energy +5 through a supposedly-ancient (but actually fairly modern) ritual. The ritual need only be performed once; the effects are permanent. It must be performed outdoors while suffering from at least two diseases and two curses.
23154.Name: Final Rites of Cae-a-Lee

23155.Description: Increase your Maximum Tempest Energy +5 through a simple but extremely lengthy ritual. The ritual need only be performed once; the effects are permanent. Must be performed near a meditation pillar.
23155.Name: Mope's Method

23156.Description: Increase your Maximum Tempest Energy +5 through an extraordinarily painful ritual. The ritual need only be performed once; the effects are permanent. Must be performed outdoors while suffering from 20 broken bones.
23156.Name: The Flopsy Dance

23157.Description: Increase your Maximum Tempest Energy +5 through a simple ritual that expands your understanding. The ritual need only be performed once; the effects are permanent. Must be performed outdoors while fully submerged in water.
23157.Name: Meditation on Water

23158.Description: Increase your Maximum Tempest Energy +5 through a ritual that expands your understanding. The ritual need only be performed once; the effects are permanent. It must be performed outdoors while severely intoxicated and suffering from a pineal juice hangover.
23158.Name: Paullus's Pulsing Reminder

23159.Description: Increase your Maximum Tempest Energy +5 by reciting elven verses that can expand your mind. The recitation need only be performed once; the effects are permanent. It must be performed outdoors while enjoying post-coital bliss.
23159.Name: Errana's Soliloquy

23160.Description: Increase your Maximum Tempest Energy +5 by reciting an ancient elven story that can expand your mind. The recitation need only be performed once; the effects are permanent. It must be performed outdoors while surrounded by at least 20 growing garden plants.
23160.Name: Errana's Lesson To Kirad

OtherRequirements.ErrorMessage: You need more growing vegetables nearby.

23161.Description: Increase your Maximum Tempest Energy +5 through a simple ceremony said to expand your mind. The recitation need only be performed once; the effects are permanent. It must be performed while sitting in shallow water after having just licked a toxic frog.
23161.Name: Lessons of the Swamp

23201.Description: Analyze a piece of equipment to study how it works. The item is not lost or damaged. You can only study each type of item one time -- further study of similar items gains you nothing. You can only perform Hoplology Research once every 5 minutes.
23201.Name: Hoplology Research

23251.Description: Study the bones, organs, or body parts of a deceased creature to get a hint about your future. You may not like what you see, but the odds of a good omen are in your favor.
23251.Name: Beginner's Augury

23252.Description: Study the bones, organs, or body parts of a deceased creature to get a hint about your future. You may not like what you see, but the odds of a good omen are in your favor. This augury tends to have more potent futures -- both good and ill -- than the Beginner's Augury.
23252.Name: Basic Augury

23253.Description: Study the bones, organs, or body parts of a deceased creature to get a hint about your future. You may not like what you see, but the odds of a good omen are in your favor. This augury tends to have more potent futures -- both good and ill -- than the Basic Augury. It is also more sensitive to the body part used, with more possible outcomes for certain parts.
23253.Name: Advanced Augury

23254.Description: Study the bones, organs, or body parts of a deceased creature to get a hint about your future. You may not like what you see, but the odds of a good omen are in your favor. This augury tends to have more potent futures -- both good and ill -- than the Advanced Augury. Like the Advanced Augury, it is sensitive to the body part used, with more possible outcomes for certain parts.
23254.Name: Expert Augury

23271.Description:
Perform a mind-altering ritual so that you can perceive newly-spawned monsters 2 seconds before they actually appear.

The effect does not wear off, but whenever you die there's a 5% chance that it will end.
23271.Name: Perceive Spawn Premonitions (2 secs)

23272.Description:
Perform a mind-altering ritual so that you can perceive newly-spawned monsters 4 seconds before they actually appear.

The effect does not wear off, but whenever you die there's a 5% chance that it will end.
23272.Name: Perceive Spawn Premonitions (4 secs)

23273.Description:
Perform a mind-altering ritual so that you can perceive newly-spawned corporeal undead 10 seconds before they actually appear.

The effect does not wear off, but whenever you die there's a 5% chance that it will end.
23273.Name: Perceive Undead Spawn Premonitions (10 secs)

23601.Description: Dump out a beer keg and clean the container so it can be used again. There's a small chance that the container will be too damaged to be reused.
23601.Name: Reuse Beer Keg

23602.Description: Dump out a cask of hard liquor and clean the container so it can be used again. There's a small chance the barrel will be too damaged to be reused.
23602.Name: Reuse Liquor Barrel

23603.Description: Attach a tap to a barrel of beer or hard liquor and deploy it. The barrel will IMMEDIATELY APPEAR near you, and any players can drink from it. The barrel will persist until all alcohol is consumed (or very slowly evaporates). The barrel cannot be reused. If the barrel is inscribed prior to being tapped, the inscription will be shown to all who drink from it.

Ingredients.Description: Beer Keg or Hard Liquor Barrel

23603.Name: Tap Alcohol Keg

23651.Description: A simple, watery, slightly insipid beer.

Ingredients.Description: Fruit: Red Apple, Grapes, Orange, or Strawberry

23651.Name: Basic Lager (One Glass)

23652.Description: A surprisingly complex beer, but... complexity doesn't always taste good.

Ingredients.Description: Fruit: Red Apple, Grapes, Orange, or Strawberry
Mushroom Flakes: Parasol, Mycena, Boletus, or Field

23652.Name: Pale Ale (One Glass)

23653.Description: A medium-body beer with a malty flavor.

Ingredients.Description: Fruit: Red Apple, Grapes, Orange, or Strawberry
Mushroom Flakes: Parasol, Mycena, Boletus, or Field

23653.Name: Marzen (One Glass)

23654.Description: A hoppy beer with hints of spice.

Ingredients.Description: Fruit: Red Apple, Grapes, or Orange
Mushroom Flakes: Parasol, Mycena, Boletus, or Field

23654.Name: Goblin Ale (One Glass)

23655.Description: A clean, dry beer that goes down easy.

Ingredients.Description: Mushroom Flakes/Powders: Field, Blusher, Milk Cap, Blood

23655.Name: Orcish Bock (One Glass)

23656.Description: A sweet beer with hints of chocolate.

Ingredients.Description: Green Pepper, Red Pepper, Molasses, or Corn
Mushroom Flakes/Powders: Field, Blusher, Milk Cap, Blood

23656.Name: Brown Ale (One Glass)

23657.Description: A clean beer with hints of oak and licorice. The preferred drink of humans in the Crone Hegemony.

Ingredients.Description: Green Pepper, Red Pepper, Molasses, or Corn
Fruit: Pear, Peach, or Green Apple
Mushroom Flakes/Powders: Field, Blusher, Milk Cap, Blood

23657.Name: Hegemony Lager (One Glass)

23658.Description: A strong dark beer that packs a punch. The preferred socialization drink of dwarves.

Ingredients.Description: Green Pepper, Red Pepper, Molasses, or Corn
Fruit: Pear, Peach, or Green Apple
Mushroom Flakes/Powders: Coral, Groxmax, Porcini, Black Foot Morel

23658.Name: Dwarven Stout (One Glass)

23659.Description: A golden beer with a slightly bitter taste.

Ingredients.Description: Green Pepper, Red Pepper, Molasses, or Corn
Fruit: Pear, Peach, or Green Apple
Mushroom Flakes/Powders: Coral, Groxmax, Porcini, Black Foot Morel

23659.Name: Pilsner (One Glass)

23701.Description: A simple, watery, slightly insipid beer.

23701.Name: Basic Lager Keg

23706.Name: Brown Ale Keg

23709.Name: Pilsner Keg

23710.Description: A pleasant beer that strongly takes on the characteristics of its flavoring ingredients.

Ingredients.Description: Green Pepper, Red Pepper, Molasses, or Corn
Fruit: Pear, Peach, or Green Apple
Mushroom Flakes/Powders: Coral, Groxmax, Porcini, Black Foot Morel

23710.Name: Porter Keg

23751.Description: Prepares a cask of vodka for aging. The cask must then be stored in a cave until it is mature.
23751.Name: Potato Vodka (Un-Aged)

23752.Description: Prepares a cask of applejack brandy for aging. The cask must then be stored in a cave until it is mature.
23752.Name: Applejack (Un-Aged)

23753.Description: Prepares a cask of vodka for aging. The cask must then be stored in a cave until it is mature.
23753.Name: Beet Vodka (Un-Aged)

23754.Description: Prepares a cask of rum for aging. The cask must then be stored in a cave until it is mature.
23754.Name: Pale Rum (Un-Aged)

23755.Description: Prepares a cask of whisky for aging. The cask must then be stored in a cave until it is mature.
23755.Name: Whisky (Un-Aged)

23756.Description: Prepares a cask of tequila for aging. The cask must then be stored in a cave until it is mature.
23756.Name: Tequila (Un-Aged)

23757.Description: Prepares a cask of gin for aging. The cask must then be stored in a cave until it is mature.
23757.Name: Dry Gin (Un-Aged)

23758.Description: Prepares a cask of bourbon for aging. The cask must then be stored in a cave until it is mature.
23758.Name: Bourbon (Un-Aged)

23801.Description: A very rough alcoholic beverage. Some say you grow to like the taste, but others say that's just your tastebuds dying from the pain.

Ingredients.Description: Fruit: Red Apple, Grapes, or Orange
Mushroom Flakes: Parasol, Mycena, Boletus, or Field
Boar Tusk, Cat Eyeball, Snail Sinews, Rat Tail, or Basic Fish Scales
Oregano, Mandrake Root, Peppercorns or Grass

23801.Name: Potato Vodka (Drinkable Cask)

23802.Description: Apple brandy, with a distinctive apple taste and a strong kick. A longtime favorite of rural humans.

Ingredients.Description: Fruit: Red Apple, Grapes, or Orange
Boar Tusk, Cat Eyeball, Snail Sinews, Rat Tail, or Basic Fish Scales
Oregano, Mandrake Root, Peppercorns or Grass

23802.Name: Applejack (Drinkable Cask)

23803.Description: A sweet, relatively palatable variety of vodka. Although it's a traditional dwarven drink, it long ago fell out of favor, and these days dwarves only use it for cooking.

Ingredients.Description: Mushroom Flakes: Parasol, Mycena, Boletus, or Field
Boar Tusk, Cat Eyeball, Snail Sinews, Rat Tail, or Basic Fish Scales
Oregano, Mandrake Root, Peppercorns or Grass

23803.Name: Beet Vodka (Drinkable Cask)

23804.Description: Sweet and strong, with the distinctive odor of molasses. In far-off lands, ranalon produce and drink rum in tremendous quantities, but it's less common -- and less delicious -- in Alharth.

Ingredients.Description: Mushroom Flakes/Powders: Field, Blusher, Milk Cap, Blood
Boar Tusk, Cat Eyeball, Snail Sinews, Rat Tail, or Basic Fish Scales
Oregano, Mandrake Root, Peppercorns or Grass

23804.Name: Pale Rum (Drinkable Cask)

23805.Description: A simple variety of whisky made from barley. It's drinkable and has a tolerable flavor.

Ingredients.Description: Mushroom Flakes/Powders: Field, Blusher, Milk Cap, Blood
Wolf Teeth, Panther Tail, Deinonychus Claw, Rabbit's Foot, or Bear Gallbladder
Oregano, Mandrake Root, Peppercorns or Grass

23805.Name: Whisky (Drinkable Cask)

23806.Description: Fermented cactus juice with a complex taste. This variety has been aged to make it more drinkable. (It's "more" drinkable, but still not "very" drinkable -- it's an acquired taste.) The stereotypical drink of rakshasa desert bandits.

Ingredients.Description: Mushroom Flakes/Powders: Field, Blusher, Milk Cap, Blood
Wolf Teeth, Panther Tail, Deinonychus Claw, Rabbit's Foot, or Bear Gallbladder
Cinnamon, Muntok Peppercorns, Seaweed, or Myconian Jelly

23806.Name: Tequila (Drinkable Cask)

23807.Description: Pleasant, slightly citrusy, but with a distinctive bitterness too. It's said to be the favorite hard liquor of elves, but since elves mostly drink wine, that's not much praise.

Ingredients.Description: Fruit: Pear, Peach, or Green Apple
Mushroom Flakes/Powders: Coral, Groxmax, Porcini, Black Foot Morel
Wolf Teeth, Panther Tail, Deinonychus Claw, Rabbit's Foot, or Bear Gallbladder
Cinnamon, Muntok Peppercorns, Seaweed, or Myconian Jelly

23807.Name: Dry Gin (Drinkable Cask)

23808.Description: Made from fermented corn mash, this is very mellow and drinkable. This is the favored drink of Councilwoman Sereel "The Steel" Avenbule. She holds a bourbon competition each year in Vidaria.

Ingredients.Description: Fruit: Pear, Peach, or Green Apple
Mushroom Flakes/Powders: Coral, Groxmax, Porcini, Black Foot Morel
Cockatrice Beak, Worm Tooth, Ectoplasm, Powdered Mammal, or Barghest Flesh
Mint, Honey, Juniper Berries, or Almonds

23808.Name: Bourbon (Drinkable Cask)

23851.Description: Although there might be delicious varieties of strawberry wine out there somewhere, this is not it: the strawberry flavor is undermined by a grassy taste.
23851.Name: Strawberry Wine (Cask)

23852.Description: A drinkable wine, but with a slightly musky taste and odor. This is definitely not the kind of wine that elves drink in Verta! But it's not horrible.
23852.Name: Concord Wine (Cask)

23853.Description: With notes of citrus and sweetness, this is a decent table wine.
23853.Name: Orange Wine (Cask)

23854.Description: Given that it was made from carrots, this wine is... surprisingly good!
23854.Name: Carrot Wine (Cask)

23855.Description: A buttery, banana-flavored wine that's quite a mouthful.
23855.Name: Banana Wine (Cask)

23857.Description: A very dry wine that's quite drinkable.
23857.Name: Rice Wine (Cask)

23858.Description: A dry wine. It has a slightly piney smell, but it's not pleasant.
23858.Name: Juniper Wine (Cask)

24.Description: Peel, wash, and de-vein a shrimp.
24.Name: Cleaned Shrimp

24021.Description: Dye used to color armor deep sky blue. You only receive XP the first time you complete this recipe.
24021.Name: Deep Sky Blue Dye

24022.Description: Dye used to color armor tomato red. You only receive XP the first time you complete this recipe.
24022.Name: Tomato Red Dye

24023.Description: Dye used to color armor dark violet. You only receive XP the first time you complete this recipe.

24026.Description: Dye used to color armor pale goldenrod. You only receive XP the first time you complete this recipe.

24027.Description: Dye used to color armor pale marigold. You only receive XP the first time you complete this recipe.
24027.Name: Pale Marigold Dye

24028.Description: Dye used to color armor purple. You only receive XP the first time you complete this recipe.
24028.Name: Purple Dye

24029.Description: Dye used to color armor red. You only receive XP the first time you complete this recipe.

24030.Description: Dye used to color armor light gray. You only receive XP the first time you complete this recipe.

24031.Description: Dye used to color armor thistle. You only receive XP the first time you complete this recipe.
24031.Name: Thistle Dye

24032.Description: Dye used to color armor drab grass green. You only receive XP the first time you complete this recipe.
24032.Name: Drab Grass Green Dye

24033.Description: Dye used to color armor lemon chiffon. You only receive XP the first time you complete this recipe.

26661.Description: A musty outdoor scent that makes you want to go outdoors and hit stuff.

26663.Description: A no-nonsense outdoor scent that makes you want to go out and crush things.

26664.Description: A feral assault on the nose that enhances your need to fight!

26665.Description: An eye-watering odor that urges you to go get physically violent.

26666.Description: Somewhere between a foul odor and a pleasant one, this amps your adrenal system for fighting.
26666.Name: Quality Brisk Candle

26667.Description: An almost-malignant odor that sends your body into a ferocious snarl.

26668.Description: A viceral odor experience that causes you to clench your fists in exuberance.

26676.Description: All the smells of a scrub tree in a swamp to help you get into a natural mindset.

26677.Description: The smell of bark and pollen isn't pleasant, but it turns your thoughts to nature.

26678.Description: A not-quite-pleasant pine candle that focuses your instincts toward nature.

26679.Description: A collection of woodsy odors to remind you of your place in nature.

26680.Description: A barrage of potent smells one could conceivably find in a forest. It's somehow a nice scent.

26681.Description: A pleasant smell that evokes the forest without burying you in it.
26681.Name: Quality Woodland Candle

26682.Description: A delicate smell that pulls at the edges of your memories and reminds you of the power of nature.
26682.Name: Great Woodland Candle

26683.Description: The smell of the forest, idealized and crystallized into a dramatic burst of memories.

26691.Description: It has a vague flower smell.

26696.Description: A potent floral scent that features red roses plucked at the height of their crimson yearning. Or so it smells.
26696.Name: Quality Floral Candle

26697.Description: The elven lily provides a base scent for this candle, and the bitter-cold winterhue flower accentuates it.
26697.Name: Great Floral Candle

26698.Description: A scent that brings forth happy visions of flowers basking in the sun.
26698.Name: Amazing Floral Candle

26708.Description: It smells like burned bacon! Which isn't a great smell. It makes you really want to eat some bacon, though.
26708.Name: Crude Bacon Candle

26710.Description: The lovely aroma of bacon reminds you of how tasty bacon is.
26710.Name: Nice Bacon Candle

26712.Description: This smell is a cultivated bacon odor, accentuating the highs and diminishing the lows, making real bacon taste incredible.
26712.Name: Amazing Bacon Candle

26723.Description: An almost-overpowering odor of the sea. It reminds you to hold your breath underwater.
26723.Name: Crude Seafoam Candle

26725.Description: A tantalizing reminder of the beach.
26725.Name: Nice Seafoam Candle

26727.Description: You can almost hear the ocean waves when you smell this pleasing sea-inspired aroma.
26727.Name: Amazing Seafoam Candle

26738.Description: The smell of sand in wind. Because there's nothing like smelling a sandstorm in the air to quicken one's pace.
26738.Name: Crude Desert Breeze Candle

26740.Description: A bouquet of aromas that bring to mind sprinting in the endless desert.
26740.Name: Nice Desert Breeze Candle

26742.Description: This delicate smell evokes the desert without actually having any icky desert smells.
26742.Name: Amazing Desert Breeze Candle

26753.Description: This smells like a cold, cold, morning in a fairly-unpleasant-smelling place.
26753.Name: Crude Arctic Dawn Candle

26755.Description: This smells like a warm drink on a cold, cold morning.
26755.Name: Nice Arctic Dawn Candle

26756.Description: This smells like a warm drink on a cold, cold morning.
26756.Name: Nice Arctic Dawn Candle (Variant)

26757.Description: This smells like waking up to a cold dawn around a warming campfire, with a loving pet wolf-dog nearby who's happy you're finally awake.
26757.Name: Amazing Arctic Dawn Candle

26768.Description: A heady bouquet encompassing the beauty of both life and death. It has a slightly hallucinogenic effect.
26768.Name: Crude Dark Sight Candle

26770.Description: A heady bouquet encompassing the beauty of both life and death. It has a slightly hallucinogenic effect.
26770.Name: Nice Dark Sight Candle

26772.Description: A heady bouquet encompassing the beauty of both life and death. It has a slightly hallucinogenic effect.
26772.Name: Amazing Dark Sight Candle

26781.Description: An intoxicating aroma of autumn flavors mixed with potent hallucinogens.
26781.Name: Lich Illusion Candle

26901.Description: A mildly perfumed wax that helps ensure mating success with bees or wasps.
26901.Name: Perfumed Wax

26902.Description: A pungent smelling wax that helps ensure mating success with bees or wasps.
26902.Name: Enticing Wax

26903.Description: An oily wax that smells great to bees. Used to help ensure mating success with bees or wasps.
26903.Name: Stimulating Wax

30105.Description:
Makes one piece of equipment permanently look like another piece of equipment.

The glamoured item will have the same dye coloration as the item it's copied from. You cannot re-dye a glamoured item.

If the new appearance is specific to an animal form (e.g. werewolf armor), the glamour only applies when worn in that animal form.
30105.Name: Apply Glamour to Item (via Berry)

30106.Description:

30106.Name: Apply Glamour to Item (via Gourd)

30107.Description:
Consume a flower (or flower arrangement). For 30 minutes after, the Mentalism abilities Health Wave, Armor Wave, and Power Wave have increased potency. The increase depends on the quality of the flower(s) consumed.

You must be a butterfly to use this technique, and you must meet the flower(s)'s skill requirements, if any.
30107.Name: Drink Nectar (as a Butterfly)

7866.Description:

8501.Description: Manually remove the seeds from cotton and stretch it out for yarn production. This manual method is extremely slow compared to using a cotton gin.
8501.Name: Carded Cotton

8502.Description: Remove the seeds and prepare cotton with a cotton gin. 35% of the time you also manage to collect enough quality fibers to make a bundle of Perfect Cotton, too. (Must be near a cotton gin.)
8502.Name: Carded Cotton (from Cotton Gin)

8503.Description: Remove the seeds and prepare cotton with a cotton gin. Because of your expert skill, there is a higher chance of obtaining Perfect Cotton. (Must be near a cotton gin.)
8503.Name: Carded Cotton (Expert Level)

8504.Description: Remove the seeds and prepare cotton with a cotton gin. Because of your master skill, less raw cotton is required. (Must be near a cotton gin.)
8504.Name: Carded Cotton (Master Level)

8521.Description: Create rough yarn from prepared cotton.
8521.Name: Coarse Cotton Yarn

8522.Description: Create smooth yarn from prepared cotton.
8522.Name: Fine Cotton Yarn

8523.Description: Create a spool of thread from fine yarn and spider's web. This recipe creates 4 spools of thread.
8523.Name: Cotton Thread

8524.Description: Cotton cloth that's extremely porous. Ideal for butter and certain cheeses.
8524.Name: Butter Muslin

8525.Description: Cotton cloth that's very porous. Ideal for use in creating mold cheeses.
8525.Name: Voile Muslin

8526.Description: Porous cotton that's resistant to heat. Ideal for creating hard cheeses.
8526.Name: Cheesecloth

8527.Description: Porous cotton that's resistant to heat. Ideal for creating mold cheeses that take a long time to ripen.
8527.Name: Fine Cheesecloth

8530.Description: Create a small spindle of string. Useful in many crafts, like fishing and tailoring.
8530.Name: String (from Cotton)

8531.Description: Create a small spindle of string. Useful in many crafts, like fishing and tailoring.
8531.Name: String (from Spiderweb)

8532.Description: A porous sticky cloth that's useful for some basic garments.
8532.Name: Basic Spider Silk

8533.Description: A sticky cloth that's ideal for certain types of clothing.
8533.Name: Spider Silk

8534.Description: This strange cloth is smooth and cool to the touch.
8534.Name: Strong Spider Silk

8535.Description: This strange cloth is luxurious to the touch, yet incredibly strong.
8535.Name: Extreme Spider Silk

8536.Description: This strange cloth is luxurious to the touch, yet incredibly strong.
8536.Name: Incredible Spider Silk

8537.Description: Create a bit of low-quality gauze that is used to keep flowers organized in an arrangement. This recipe creates two.
8537.Name: Flower Wrap

8538.Description: Create a bit of very specialized cloth that is used by expert flower arrangers. This recipe creates three.
8538.Name: Flower Banding

8551.Description: An elegant silk with supernatural lightness and toughness.

8557.Description: Creates comfortable padding for a saddle.

8558.Description: Creates comfortable and stylish padding for a saddle.
8558.Name: Impressive Saddle Blanket

9001.Description: Ties your soul to a particular Teleportation Circle so that you can return to it via Teleportation magic. You must be standing on a Teleportation Circle.
9001.Name: Bind Circle

9002.Description: Sends you back to the Teleportation Circle you are bound to. You must be standing on a Teleportation Circle.
9002.Name: Recall Circle

9003.Description: Sends you back to the Teleportation Circle you are bound to. You do not need to be in a Teleportation Circle to use this technique, but this technique has a 60-minute cooldown before it can be used again.
9003.Name: Recall Circle (Improvised)

9005.Description: Teleports you to the entrance of the area you're currently in.
9005.Name: Recall Beginnings

9006.Description: Sends you back to the Teleportation Circle you last Recalled to. (Normally this would be the one you are bound to, unless you've bound to a different location since your last teleport.) You must be standing on a Teleportation Circle.
9006.Name: Recall Last Recall

9007.Description: Sends you to a Teleportation Circle that you have recalled to relatively recently. You must be standing on a Teleportation Circle.
9007.Name: Recall Somewhere

9008.Description: Sends you to the Teleportation Circle that you have recalled to the highest number of times in your life. You must be standing on a Teleportation Circle.
9008.Name: Recall Heart's Home

9009.Description: Ties your soul to a particular Teleportation Circle so that you can return to it via "Recall Alternate Circle". You must be standing on a Teleportation Circle.
9009.Name: Bind Alternate Circle

901.Description: Prepare basic fertilizer, suitable for fertilizing simple flowers and some vegetables. Creates three doses.
901.Name: Basic Fertilizer (from Dirt)

9010.Description: Sends you back to the alternate Teleportation Circle you are bound to. You must be standing on a Teleportation Circle.
9010.Name: Recall Alternate Circle

9011.Description: Teleports you to the entrance of the area you're currently in.
9011.Name: Recall Beginnings (Hardcore)

9012.Description: Teleports you back to wherever your guild's home position is set to. Costs 2 Guild Credits. (Note: currently all guilds' home positions are in Rahu, but eventually they will be able to pick from different cities.)
9012.Name: Return to Guild Hall

9013.Description: Teleports you to the Serbule docks. Can be used once per hour.
9013.Name: Recall Serbule Docks

9014.Description: Teleports you to the animal camp in Gazluk. Can be used once per hour.
9014.Name: Recall Gazluk Animal Camp

902.Description: An alternate way to create basic fertilizer that uses a whole bunch of bone meal as the key ingredient. Creates three doses.
902.Name: Basic Fertilizer (from Bone)

9020.Description: Sends you back to the alternate Teleportation Circle you are bound to. You do not need to be in a Teleportation Circle to use this technique, but this technique has a 60-minute cooldown before it can be used again.
9020.Name: Recall Alternate Circle (Improvised)

9021.Description: Creates a dimensional rift that leads to your bound Teleportation Circle. Any number of players can enter the rift. It lasts for two minutes. This technique has a 60-minute cooldown before it can be used again.
9021.Name: Summon Portal

9022.Description: Creates a dimensional rift that leads to your alternate-bound Teleportation Circle. Any number of players can enter the rift. It lasts for two minutes. This technique has a 60-minute cooldown before it can be used again.
9022.Name: Summon Alternate Portal

903.Description: An alternate way to create basic fertilizer that uses rotten meat as the key ingredient. Creates three doses.
903.Name: Basic Fertilizer (from Rotten Meat)

904.Description: Sift through a pile of grass, looking for plantable barley seeds. Yields between 0 and 3 seeds.
904.Name: Sift Through Grass For Barley Seeds

9051.Description: Summon a special druidic storage container. Must be near a teleportation platform. This can be used during a druidic emergency and up to an hour before or after the emergency.
9051.Name: Summon Druidic Storage (12-slot)

9052.Description: Summon a special druidic storage container. Must be near a teleportation platform. This can be used during a druidic emergency and up to an hour before or after the emergency.
9052.Name: Summon Druidic Storage (20-slot)

9081.Description: Sends you from one mushroom circle to another mushroom circle in your current area.

9082.Description: While standing in a mushroom circle, return to the fae realm. Can be cast once per 15 minutes.
9082.Name: (Fae Only) Return to Fae Realm

9085.Description: Teleports you to the entrance of the area you're currently in.
